Starstorm:

"Hu, ah"starstorm was taken by surprice "ER... i'm starstorm, it's 
great to see new faces here... Do you know the rules? you should... 
whatc out, here comes the the first enemy of Decepticons femmes: 
Perceptor."

Perceptor growles and said "So do you want to know the Base, some 
areas are restricted and just Hydras and his closed ones can come 
in. Until you prove decerve that honor, you only can acces to common 
areas as the others preds... agree?"

and the male gone.

"Don't heard him" said the femme"Perceptor is famous in femenine-
decepticons comunity by the fact to heat femmes in Decepticons' and 
Predacons' ranks"



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "raccoon7679 <raccoon7679@y...>" 
<raccoon7679@y...> wrote:
> KitKat::
> 
> She looked at the two bots converse.  She nodded to Starstorm.
>  "Hello. I am KitKat. Newly joined to the ranks."
> She noticed the femme bot look at her with a touch of distaste. 
She 
> didn't care. She wasn't here to find a mate. She was out to fight 
> for the faction she was now apart of.  She didn't care if this 
femme 
> didn't like her.  She only cared that this bot would show her the 
> respect she deserved.  She had killed many bots in her time. And 
> having one less bot on the planet didn't bother her.  Even if it 
was 
> one of her own.  For now, she would watch and learn about this new 
> group. Besides, she didn't think this bot mattered much in the 
> leading ranks. She was only concerned with how Hydrus saw her. She 
> wanted to lead. Not play games with bots who had soft sparks. She 
> turned and noticed another bot looking at her with google optics.  
> She shook her head. What has happened to the predacon empire since 
> her last battle?  She felt her spark fall slightly. then her spark 
> lifted. It occured to her that it would not be hard to gain power 
in 
> the ranks if the others were all that softed sparked. 
> She put her hand on her hip and swished her wolf tail. She looked 
up 
> at Perceptor,
> "Perhaps if it's not to much trouble, I would like to see the 
prints 
> for this base. If I am to be effective here, I must first now my 
own 
> ground. A wolf knows thier own backyard better than anyone. If ths 
> is to be my new base of operations, I would like to be familiar 
with 
> the layout of my new home."
> 
> 
> 
>

Girlfriend

troubles.
